picks.title: Float On - Modest Mouse
picks.comment: There's a weird, difficult-to-explain quality about this song. It really does carry you, as if floating in a lazy pool.

picks.title: Mr. Brightside - The Killers
picks.comment: I can't help drumming or singing along to this (and I can't do either). Based on events where this song plays, neither can anyone else.

picks.title: Hello - Martin Solveig
picks.comment: My jam. This is the musical equivalent to four or five jaegerbombs.

picks.title: Anna Sun - Walk the Moon
picks.comment: I could copy and paste most of what I wrote about Mr. Brightside here. It's the track I look forward to in any playlist it's in.

picks.title: Jupiter - Gustav Holst
picks.comment: I listened to this song before every exam I have taken, and it has not let me down yet. Swells up into epic.

picks.title: Die Young - Ke$ha
picks.comment: This has all the ingredients for a great 'don't pay attention to it' pop classic. Catchy beat, repetitive chorus, and terribly simple lyrics.

picks.title: Sharin no Uta - Bump of Chicken
picks.comment: Ousted "Tentai Kansoku" as ultimately it reminds me of cycling in perfect weather, which is something everyone should enjoy.

picks.title: Homecoming - Kanye West & Chris Martin
picks.comment: Difficult to pick between Kanye songs, but not many open up with a sweet allusion to Common's 'I Used to Love H.E.R.'

picks.title: Honourable Mentions
picks.comment: No Drake? Imagine Dragons? T-Swift?!? Great artists, but lacked 'That One Song'. Macklemore, Eminem and the Mowglis were unlucky too. I'm sure they'll all be upset.
